text: The Alton Bridge was a railroad bridge that carried the Chicago, Burlington, and Quincy (later Burlington Northern) across the Mississippi River between West Alton, Missouri, and Alton, Illinois. It was located upriver from, and parallel to, the Old Clark Bridge. The bridge was built between 1892 and 1894 and was removed shortly after the line was abandoned in 1988. With a total length of , it consisted of eight through-truss segments—six Pratt trusses, one Pennsylvania truss, and one pivot-swinging truss. ==See also== *List of crossings of the Upper Mississippi River *Lock and Dam No. 26 (historical) ==External links== *Bridgehunter Category:Railroad bridges in Illinois Category:Railroad bridges in Missouri Category:St. Charles, Missouri Category:Alton, Illinois Category:Pratt truss bridges in the United States Category:Swing bridges in the United States Category:Metal bridges in the United States Category:Pennsylvania truss bridges in the United States Category:Bridges in Madison County, Illinois Category:Buildings and structures in St. Charles County, Missouri
title: Alton Bridge
